snippet: Mr. Heastie was able to hold onto a home that prosecutors said his mother had bought with embezzled money; selling it years later brought what appears to be the only significant financial gain of his life.
abstract: New York Assembly Speaker Carl E Heastie appears to have profited from sale of home that his mother Helene bought with embezzled money; Heastie's mother pleaded guilty to embezzlement in 1998 and was ordered to sell her Bronx home, but Heastie managed to hold on to it and sell it six years later for significant profit; it is unclear how Heastie held on to home, and could be due to carelessness or something more questionable.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: Mr. Heastie was able to hold onto a home that prosecutors said his mother had bought with embezzled money; selling it years later brought what appears to be the only significant financial gain of his life.

headline.main: Carl Heastie, New York Assembly Speaker, Benefited From His Mother’s Embezzling
headline.print_headline: Assembly Speaker Benefited From His Mother’s Embezzlement
